project.description: Commercial renovation of occupied mixed-use building in downtown Los Angeles. Project ID: LA-CR-0426-MX. Building must remain partially operational with tenants on floors 2 and 4 during weekdays. Scope includes electrical rewiring (legacy copper/aluminum), HVAC system upgrade, interior redesign (lobby, common areas, 3 office floors). Target budget: $1.2M (acceptable up to $1.35M). Target timeline: 6 months (acceptable extension 2 weeks). Operational constraints: No full-day power shutdowns on weekdays, noise-intensive work restricted to weekends/nights, HVAC downtime staged floor-by-floor. Must comply with California Title 24. Priorities: Delivery risk and operational disruption are higher priority than cost. Willing to accept slightly higher cost/longer timeline if risk and disruption are demonstrably lower.

bids.scope: Complete electrical rewiring including legacy copper and aluminum systems, full HVAC system upgrade with central and floor-level units, comprehensive interior redesign of lobby, common areas, and 3 office floors. Includes fire suppression system upgrade, seismic bracing recommendations, and all permits. Phased approach to maintain tenant operations on floors 2 and 4. All work scheduled to avoid weekday power shutdowns.
HVAC system upgrade and interior redesign of lobby and common areas. Electrical work will be subcontracted to local partner. Phased approach for occupied building operations.
Interior redesign work only. Client to manage MEP systems separately through other contractors.
